If so, there is no basis to the Davidic—Solomonic kingdom. But the majority of archaeologists adhere to the previously held view, indicating the factuality of the kingdom of David and Solomon. The name of king David, as well as of king Solomon, had not been found in extra—Biblical sources, but David is now attested in the toponym bytdwd (House of David, i.e. the name of the kingdom of Judah) in an Aramaean inscription from the 9th century B.C., found at Dan.
